item.title: Learning About Python
item.description: Python in Genetics Prior to my participation in this class, I had never before worked with Python. While it was (and honestly still is) intimidating at first, I have slowly been getting more comfortable working with Python. I can now definitely see how proficiency in Python is a useful tool to have in computational biology/bioinformatics. Since my degree in biology specifically focuses on genetics and genomics, it was particularly interesting to me when we used regular expressions in python to find endonuclease target sites within a sequence of DNA.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Below are some of the projects I have been working on: -Project 1 -Project 2

item.title: Priess_Project1
item.description: Introduction The datasets that I chose for this project were a dataset on global life expectancy, a dataset on global health expenditure per capita, and a dataset on each country’s region and income group. The global life expectancy dataset was obtained from GitHub (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday). This dataset contained information regarding the life expectancy in years for countries throughout the globe. The variables in the dataset were Entity, Code, Year, and Life Expectancy (Years).

item.title: Project 2
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.3.3 ## ✔ tibble 2.1.3 ✔ dplyr 0.8.3 ## ✔ tidyr 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✔ readr 1.3.1 ✔ forcats 0.4.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lmtest) ## Loading required package: zoo ## ## Attaching package: 'zoo' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## as.

item.title: Resume
item.description: About Me I grew up in the small town of Stonewall, Texas working on my family’s peach farm with my parents and younger brother. After high school, I moved to Austin to attend college, and I am currently studying Biology and Psychology. Ultimately, my goal is to attend medical school to become a general, family physician. In my spare time, I love volunteering with several different organizations around the Austin community including the Ride On Center for Kids, Dell Children’s Hospital, and Foundation Communities.
